0.text: Bug 13925  Error reported on stderr when .project is read-only.

1.text: Build 20020412  1) Create two simple projects, P1 and P2 2) Make the .project file for P1 read-only on the resource info property page 3) Go to the project references property page, and add a reference to P2  An error dialog pops up, saying that .project is read-only.

3.text: However, it also prints the following to stderr (appears in the java console):  Error in ProjectReferencePage.doOk Reason: File /S2/.project is read-only.

4.text: This originates from ProjectReferencePage#handle  1) The message refers to a method that doesn't exist 2) This message suggests that an internal error has occurred, but this is  actually an expected case (ie, CoreException usually means user error, not  program error).

5.text: 3) I noticed that the error dialog title is not NLS'd, but probaby should be  since it's being presented to the user.
